West Hampstead is a ward in the London Borough of Camden, in the United Kingdom. It was established for the May 2002 local elections. The population of West Hampstead ward is 11,658, while the ward had an electorate of 8,322 in 2018. It underwent minor boundary changes for the 2022 election. , it forms part of the Hampstead and Highgate parliamentary constituency, whose MP is Tulip Siddiq (Labour).

Camden council elections since 2022
There was a revision of ward boundaries in Camden in 2022.
2025 by-election
The by-election took place on 28 August 2025, following the resignation of Shiva Tiwari. On 18 March 2025, Tiwari defected from the Labour Party to the Conservative Party. CCTV footage published on 17 July 2025 showed a confrontation with a shop owner in West Hampstead, during which Tiwari threatened to close the business down. He resigned from the Conservative Party and the council the same day.
}}
2022 election
The election took place on 5 May 2022.
2002–2022 Camden council elections
|frame=yes|text=West Hampstead ward boundaries from 2002 to 2022}}
2018 election
The election took place on 3 May 2018.
2014 election
The election took place on 22 May 2014.
2010 election
The election on 6 May 2010 took place on the same day as the United Kingdom general election.
2006 election
The election took place on 4 May 2006.
2002 election
The election took place on 2 May 2002.
